failedToken: The session timed out. Log in to continue

start.title: Welcome to the <1 /> interactive <3>Morse</3> code course!
start.description: Sign in to an existing account or register
start.name: Name

0.description: Welcome, {{name}}! My name is <3>Meows</3>, I will be happy to help you on the course

1.description: By clicking on your name next to the avatar you will be able to see your achievements, change your data. Be sure to try to choose an avatar!

2.description: In the panel on the left you can select a section and start learning. I suggest you start with a simulator!

testing.description: I see you are ready to test yourself! If you pass this section successfully, I will reward you. Your task is to solve the cipher: listen to the Morse code (each letter is separated by a small pause) and enter the decryption (letters without spaces) into the text field below
testing.winner: Congratulations, <1>{{name}}</1>, on your successful completion of the Morse code course! I award you a certificate, you can download it and print
testing.looser: Your result is {{score}}%, and to successfully pass the test, you need to score 100%. Try our simulators to prepare better and come back again!

game.title: Mini-game
game.warning: Let me explain some rules to you, before you start.

rules.0: You will be asked several questions, your task is to choose the correct answer.
rules.1: Each correct answer gives you 10 points, incorrect answers give you nothing.
rules.2: You only have 4 minutes to answer all the questions, so hurry up!

description.0: Oops... :( You've failed this time, but I remember only your best score as I promised - {{bestScore}}! Sometimes you can try again and you will definitely succeed! But now let's try to pass next lesson :)
description.1: Congratulations, you've passed lesson {{lessonID}}. Give me a high five, you've just scored {{currentScore}} points! You can train the level again, but I will remember only your best score - {{bestScore}} :)

looser.description: The accuracy is less than 70%, you should go through the lesson {{ lessonID }} again. Don't worry, I have paws too!

aboutPage.block1-span: Morse Code (Morse Code, Morse Code) is a method of encoding characters with a sequence of sound signals according to certain rules. The code allows to encode numbers, letters, punctuation marks, service characters by means of long signals (dashes) and short (dots).
aboutPage.block2: The coding idea came from Samuel Morse; coding of letters and numbers was done by his colleague, Alfred Weilor. Later, Friedrich Hercke improved the code to international telegraph. The first message was sent in May 1844 between Washington and Baltimore with the text “This is what God does”.
aboutPage.block3-1: two sound signals are used for coding: long (dash) and short (dot);
aboutPage.block3-2: the length of the short signal (one point) is taken as a unit of time;
aboutPage.block3-3: the length of the dash is equal to the length of three points;
aboutPage.block3-4: pause between elements of one sign - one point;
aboutPage.block3-5: pause between signs in the word - three points;
aboutPage.block3-6: a pause between words - seven points.
aboutPage.block4-title: Features of Morse code for Russian alphabet:
aboutPage.block4-1: Russian letters E and Ё are represented by one code - point;
aboutPage.block4-2: Often, instead of a solid sign, the code of the soft sign is transmitted;
aboutPage.block4-3: Some letters of the Russian alphabet (Ш, Щ and others) have no analogues in English, so the international table is extended by «Russian» variants.
aboutPage.block5: The numbers are denoted by 5 signals, where the dash is the absence and the dot is the presence of the number. Thus, 5 dashes are 0 and 5 dots are 5. The numbers from 1 to 5 are indicated by the required number of dots and by filling the dash of voids. And from six - on the contrary, first goes dashing, as the presence of the unity, emptiness are filled with dots. For illustration: three dots and two dashes - 3; three dashes and two dots - 8.
aboutPage.block6: The punctuation marks are indicated by six symbols. The dot is 6 dots (this is the pun). Comma is the alternation of a dot and a dash. Question mark - two dots, two dashes, two dots.
aboutPage.block7: The code everyone wants to know is the call for help - SOS. Its designation - three dots, three dashes, three dots. If you are a radio amateur, do not try to use his joke for fun!
